<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> This weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been pretty insane with the amount of things that needed to get done. We did manage to make some very good progress though. UI Widgets for Funds, Reputation and Science are in, several Contract system panels and UIs were revised, new visual features for UI assets got written, but thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s still quite a lot still to do. It should be a completely new experience compared to the last build we tested though. Yesterday, I got to do something IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been wanting to do for a very, very long time, actually. I did a complete redesign of the bottom-left corner of the VAB and SPH, to fit the new widgets. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very happy with how itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s turning out.</span></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>Testing last things of the new version of vBulletin 5.1, so I can do the KSP Forums upgrade next Thursday. Everything seems to be working fine, so it wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have issues. Also dealing with some billing issues from our server hosting, but theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re working that out. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll keep doing some research for another project you may know about later.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Going now into the blocking phase of the animation. This is looking fun, though IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m starting to get a little scared about render time, because of the improvements that Roger and I are doing.</span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> This week i made a big graphics update on the message system popup, the one where the actual message is displayed. Also did some tweaks on mission control to bring it in line with the suggestions weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve had.</span></p>

<p><strong>Jesus (Chuchito): </strong><span>Writing a unity port of the KSPM system.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Bob (Calisker):</strong> </span><span>Last week, we worked with Nassault on a project he did for the International Space Development Conference in Los Angeles. His videos of </span><span>KSP </span><span>were used for some educational classes at the conference focused on 3D printing. TheyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be online later and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m sure weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll make sure everybody can check them out. This week, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on brand guidelines for </span><span>KSP</span><span>, which is a fancy way of saying logo treatment and making sure that everything we do treats </span><span>KSP</span><span> with the proper respect. And if I have time, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m prepare a few more surveys to help us learn. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong> *</span><span>Over the past week I’ve been doing some admin work on Experimental and QA Teams, making sure that everything is running as it should be and planning out future changes. Additionally, I’ve been following the developments from the rest of the team so that when 0.24 returns to QA we’re raring to go.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> Some organizing and some early planning. Basically, a little bit of this, a little bit of that. Still testing some things having to do with Google+ and attempting to develop an improved strategy behind it. Also, thanks to all of you who came forward with interest in joining the mod team. I’ll be in touch with a few of you this week with further information.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Eduardo (Lalo): </strong><span>Following up some pending things and organizing some meetings with the team. </span></p>

Great Work Like Always

Edit: FIRST!

Wait, it's not Wednesday for HOURS, why are we getting the Tuesday update NOW?

Not much to comment here that I see, good to see noses to the grindstone and I can't wait to see that UI change in the VAB. I won't even ask a reconfiguring of how parts are sorted and displayed.

<p><strong>Jesus (Chuchito): </strong><span>Writing a unity port of the KSPM system.</span></p>

Wow, he stopped working on the server, unless he sent that message using it.
Tweaks to the VAB and SPH... interesting...
Keep "The Insanity" Up...

Alex (aLeXmOrA): Testing last things of the new version of vBulletin 5.1, so I can do the KSP Forums upgrade next Thursday. Everything seems to be working fine, so it wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have issues.

Careful Alex, the Kraken is listening......

Nothing from Chad or Mu again? I am sadness.

Can someone brave the smoke, fire and hail of nerf darts to venture to their domains for us? (unless they're sick or on holiday or something)

Tweaks to the VAB and SPH... interesting...

I bet they'll break my precious EditorExtensions :(

They need to just hurry up and integrate those functions into stock

I bet they'll break my precious EditorExtensions :(

They need to just hurry up and integrate those functions into stock

Agreed, and selectroot, too.

Agreed, and selectroot, too.

They break those without integration and I will flat out not play. I have become entirely dependent on having those work.

I bet they'll break my precious EditorExtensions :(

They need to just hurry up and integrate those functions into stock

Agreed. Most essential mod ever.

"Google plus things"

...don't you dare.

How would the integration of "UI Widgets for Funds, Reputation and Science" temper with any editor mods?

Not that I would not scream and roar if these mods were to break (without being fixed that is), but I am not afraid right now.
Hey everybody of the KSP comunity, i inform you that I created the Kerbal Space Program community on Google+.

Any new parts in 0.24?

I am asking because I have few projects in WIP state and finishing them will take me at least few hours per project and I wouldn't want to start again after update, if some new cool parts are going to be added.

I am asking because I have few projects in WIP state and finishing them will take me at least few hours per project and I wouldn't want to start again after update, if some new cool parts are going to be added.

Just finish your projects and use any cool new parts that might be added in new projects after those? If you're going to wait for new parts to arrive before finishing projects, you'll wait forever. It's like waiting for faster CPUs to arrive in stores.

Wait, it's not Wednesday for HOURS, why are we getting the Tuesday update NOW?

His about forum
Insanity is the way to go! Who stays normal can blame himself

Just finish your projects and use any cool new parts that might be added in new projects after those? If you're going to wait for new parts to arrive before finishing projects, you'll wait forever. It's like waiting for faster CPUs to arrive in stores.

True, but next update is possible few weeks away, so it is worth to wait with some things.

True, but next update is possible few weeks away, so it is worth to wait with some things.

At worst, finish the projects, wait for launch until update (I personnaly wouldn't) and if physicsless parts, slap these bad boys on

If you worry about big parts (0.5t+) being added, you still can come with different projects later.

There there. Some of us know the superiority that is Google Plus. In time others will see the light. It may be the light of reason, or the light of thermonuclear detonation, but light nonetheless. >
